alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Piscataquis and central Penobscot Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Mount Katahdin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millinocket, East Millinocket, Medway, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Stacyville, Grindstone and Benedicta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 247 and 262. State Highway 11 near Millinocket, and between Grindstone and Stacyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern, north central and east central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis
